intro: Paullinia itayensis, commonly known as the Brazilian soursop or itayé, is a member of the Sapindaceae family. It is a small evergreen tree native to the Atlantic Forest of eastern Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a globose, spiny berry that turns from green to yellow when mature. The plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional medicinal uses in Brazilian folk medicine.
